sentiment_score_definition: x <= -0.35: Bearish; -0.35 < x <= -0.15: Somewhat-Bearish; -0.15 < x < 0.15: Neutral; 0.15 <= x < 0.35: Somewhat_Bullish; x >= 0.35: Bullish
relevance_score_definition: 0 < x <= 1, with a higher score indicating higher relevance.

feed.title: Stem Inc. Securities Class Action Dismissed With Prejudice
feed.summary: A federal court dismissed with prejudice all claims in a securities class action against Stem Inc. and several former officers, directors, and employees on December 17, 2025. This ruling removes a significant legal burden for the company, improving its risk profile and reducing potential litigation costs and distractions. Currently, the most recent analyst rating on STEM stock is a Hold with a $22.50 price target.

feed.title: Stem Inc Announces New Chief Accounting Officer
feed.summary: Stem Inc (STEM) has announced a change in its Chief Accounting Officer position. Rahul Shukla will step down on December 19, 2025, and Mr. Jeffrey Cabot will assume the role on January 5, 2026. This leadership change is anticipated to influence the company’s financial operations and strategic direction, with current analyst ratings on STEM stock being "Hold" due to financial challenges.

feed.title: Stem, Inc. (NYSE:STEM) Receives Average Recommendation of "Reduce" from Brokerages
feed.summary: Stem, Inc. (NYSE:STEM) has received an average recommendation of "Reduce" from seven research firms, with analysts setting a 12-month consensus price target of $16.00. The company recently missed quarterly earnings expectations, reporting an EPS of ($2.84) against an expected ($1.85) and revenues of $38.24 million versus $39.07 million. Despite insider sales, institutional ownership remains high at 61.63%, with some hedge funds increasing their stakes.

feed.title: Stem Partners with Clean Energy Asset Owner to Operate and Optimize Energy Storage Portfolio for Southern California Utility
feed.summary: Stem, Inc. (NYSE: STEM) has partnered with a leading clean energy asset owner to operate and optimize a portfolio of battery energy storage systems (BESS) for a Southern California water utility. This collaboration involves four sites, including a hybrid solar and storage system, aimed at enhancing reliable performance, maximizing value, and ensuring participation in California’s Demand Response programs. Stem's PowerTrack™ Software and integrated lifecycle services will provide real-time monitoring, issue resolution, and optimization to achieve financial and operational benefits.

feed.title: Stem Inc Expands Board, Appoints CEO as Director
feed.summary: Stem Inc. has expanded its Board of Directors from seven to eight members, appointing CEO Arun Narayanan as a Class I Director without additional compensation. This move aims to strengthen leadership and governance, despite current financial challenges including negative equity and cash flow issues. Analysts currently rate STEM stock as a Hold with a $15.50 price target.

feed.title: Stem Board of Directors Appoints CEO Arun Narayanan to Board
feed.summary: Stem, Inc. announced that its Board of Directors has increased the Board size to eight and appointed CEO Arun Narayanan as a Class I Director, effective December 1, 2025. This appointment reflects the Board's confidence in Narayanan's leadership as Stem transforms into a software-centric clean energy technology company, driving strategic execution and achieving significant operational milestones. Narayanan expressed his honor and commitment to working with the Board to further Stem's strategy and accelerate the energy transition.

feed.title: Stem Appoints CEO Arun Narayanan To Board
feed.summary: Stem, Inc. (NYSE: STEM) has appointed its Chief Executive Officer, Arun Narayanan, to its Board of Directors, increasing the Board size to eight directors, effective December 1, 2025. This appointment reflects the Board's confidence in Narayanan's leadership and strategic vision as the company transforms into a software-centric clean energy technology leader. Narayanan has been instrumental in driving the company's focus on its PowerTrack™ software platform and achieving significant operational milestones since joining in January 2025.

feed.title: Stem, Inc. (NYSE:STEM) Receives Average Recommendation of "Reduce" from Brokerages
feed.summary: Stem, Inc. (NYSE:STEM) has received a consensus "Reduce" recommendation from eight brokerages, with one analyst rating it "sell" and seven "hold," and an average one-year price target of $14.57. This follows disappointing Q3 results where the company missed EPS and revenue estimates. Despite some institutional investment activity, the stock is trading near $16.25 with a market capitalization of approximately $136 million.

feed.title: Stem, Inc. (STEM) Reports Q3 Loss, Lags Revenue Estimates
feed.summary: Stem, Inc. (STEM) reported a Q3 loss of $2.84 per share, significantly missing the Zacks Consensus Estimate of a $1.85 loss, though it was an improvement from a $4.20 loss per share a year ago. The company's revenues of $38.24 million also fell short of the consensus estimate by 6.97%. Despite the recent earnings miss, Stem's shares have gained 94.5% year-to-date, outperforming the S&P 500, and it currently holds a Zacks Rank #3 (Hold) rating.

feed.title: Stem (STEM) Is Down 17.7% After Q3 Profitability Improves and Full-Year Outlook Updated - What's Changed
feed.summary: Stem, Inc. (STEM) reported improved Q3 earnings with significant year-over-year net loss reduction and updated full-year 2025 revenue guidance to US$135 million to US$160 million. The company's shift towards a software-focused model and new product launches like PowerTrack Energy Management System are highlighted as key drivers. Despite the positive operational changes, the stock is down 17.7%, and its long-term investment narrative depends on sustained high-margin software revenue growth and effective cost control.

feed.title: Stem, Inc. Reports Strong Q3 2025 Financial Results
feed.summary: Stem, Inc. announced strong financial results for Q3 2025, reporting a 31% year-over-year revenue increase to $38.2 million and achieving positive adjusted EBITDA for the second consecutive quarter. The company saw significant improvements in GAAP gross profit and net loss reduction, alongside a 17% growth in its Annual Recurring Revenue (ARR) to $60.2 million. These outcomes reflect the success of Stem's software-focused strategy and expansion into new regions, positioning it for continued profitable growth in the energy transition sector.

feed.title: Stem Announces Third Quarter 2025 Results
feed.summary: Stem Inc. reported its Q3 2025 financial results, showing a 31% year-over-year revenue increase to $38.2 million and a second consecutive quarter of positive adjusted EBITDA at $2.0 million. The company also saw its Annual Recurring Revenue (ARR) grow by 17% year-over-year to $60.2 million, driven by its strategic focus on software-centric solutions. Stem revised its full-year 2025 financial guidance, emphasizing its improved operating efficiencies and de-risked business model.

feed.title: $STEM stock is up 8% today. Here's what we see in our data.
feed.summary: STEM stock has risen 8% with significant trading volume. Insider transactions show more sales than purchases, while hedge fund activity is mixed with major institutions reducing holdings and some adding. Analysts have set a median price target of $13.0 for STEM.

feed.title: Stem Inc Issues Press Release on Compliance
feed.summary: Stem Inc issued a press release on August 7, 2025, regarding its operations and financial condition, primarily highlighting compliance with regulatory requirements. While the release confirms adherence to regulations, it does not detail the impact on stakeholders or industry positioning. Analysts currently rate STEM stock as a Hold with a $20.00 price target, and TipRanks' AI Analyst Spark views STEM as Neutral due to financial challenges despite strategic restructuring efforts.

feed.title: Stem Appoints Software and Finance Veterans to Board of Directors
feed.summary: Stem (NYSE: STEM) has appointed Krishna Shivram and Vasudevan (Vasu) Guruswamy to its Board of Directors, effective March 17, 2025. These appointments aim to strengthen the Board and support the company's software-forward strategy. Shivram brings extensive experience in corporate finance and capital structure management, while Guruswamy offers expertise in the energy, digital technology, and software industries.

feed.title: Stem Inc’s Key Proposals Approved at Annual Meeting
feed.summary: Stem Inc. announced that its stockholders approved several key proposals at the 2025 Annual Meeting, including the election of directors, an increase in shares for the 2024 Equity Incentive Plan, and a reverse stock split. These decisions aim to enhance the company's operational flexibility and market position. Analysts currently rate STEM stock as a Hold with a $0.30 price target, while TipRanks' AI Analyst, Spark, assigns a Neutral rating due to financial performance challenges.

feed.title: Stem amends bylaws to lower quorum requirement for shareholder meetings By Investing.com - Investing.com Canada
feed.summary: The article indicates an application error that is preventing the display of content about Stem amending its bylaws to lower the quorum requirement for shareholder meetings. This error is client-side, suggesting a problem with loading the page's content. Without the full content, specifics of the amended bylaws or the company's reasoning are unavailable.

feed.title: Stem Inc Reduces Quorum Requirement for Meetings - TipRanks
feed.summary: Stem Inc. has reduced the quorum requirement for its stockholder meetings from a majority to one-third of the voting power, effective October 15, 2025. This change aims to prevent additional costs and disruptions caused by adjourned meetings due to difficulties in reaching a quorum. TipRanks' AI Analyst, Spark, rates STEM as Neutral due to financial performance challenges, despite positive earnings call sentiment and strong technical indicators.

feed.title: Stem Expands its European Operations as Demand Surges for Solar Storage and Hybrid Energy Solutions - MarketScreener
feed.summary: Stem, Inc. (NYSE: STEM) is expanding its Berlin operations to meet the surging demand for solar storage and hybrid energy solutions in Europe, the Middle East, and Africa (EMEA). The company's new, larger office in Berlin will serve as its European competence center, enhancing technical depth and customer support for utility-scale projects. This expansion aims to strengthen local capabilities for faster project commissioning and post-sales support, especially for its PowerTrack Energy Management System, which is critical for optimizing hybrid solar-plus-storage integrations and managing energy markets.

feed.title: Stem Expands its European Operations as Demand Surges for Solar, Storage and Hybrid Energy Solutions
feed.summary: Stem, Inc. announced the expansion of its Berlin operations with a new centralized facility to meet the surge in demand for solar, storage, and hybrid energy solutions across the EMEA region. This expansion enhances technical depth and customer support in Europe, positioning Stem to address complex market challenges like hybrid integration and merchant risk management. The new Berlin hub will serve as Stem's European competence center, strengthening local capabilities for faster commissioning and post-sales support for renewable energy projects.

feed.title: Stem expands Berlin operations to support European renewable projects By Investing.com - Investing.com Canada
feed.summary: The article indicates an application error. Therefore, no content is available to summarize regarding Stem's expansion.

feed.title: 400m² Berlin hub: Stem expands EMEA competence center to accelerate solar & storage projects - Stock Titan
feed.summary: Stem, Inc. announced the expansion of its Berlin operations into a 400-square-meter hub, nearly doubling workspace capacity. This new competence center will centralize engineering, sales, and customer success teams to address complex European market challenges in utility-scale solar, storage, and hybrid projects. The expansion aims to strengthen local capabilities for faster commissioning and enhanced post-sales support in the EMEA region.

feed.title: Stem, Inc. Letter to Shareholders – Reflecting on our journey of strategic realignment
feed.summary: Stem, Inc. CEO Arun Narayanan reflects on the company's strategic realignment over the past year, highlighting the unification of the AlsoEnergy and Stem brands under a new corporate identity, and their products under the PowerTrack™ Suite. This realignment aims to drive innovation, deliver value to customers, and accelerate the energy transition, with key developments including the launch of PowerTrack EMS and the rebranding of Athena as PowerTrack Optimizer. The company is also showcasing its unified platform at RE+ 2025 and has refreshed its investor presentation to reflect these changes.

feed.title: Stem, Inc. (STEM) Reports Q2 Loss, Tops Revenue Estimates
feed.summary: Stem, Inc. (STEM) reported a Q2 loss of $3.73 per share, exceeding the Zacks Consensus Estimate of a $3 loss, while revenues of $38.37 million surpassed estimates by 15.93%. Despite underperforming the market year-to-date, the company has topped revenue estimates in three of the last four quarters. Stem currently holds a Zacks Rank #3 (Hold), indicating expected market-performances in the near future.

feed.title: Stem Inc Approves 1-for-20 Reverse Stock Split
feed.summary: Stem Inc. has approved a 1-for-20 reverse stock split and reduced its authorized shares, effective June 23, 2025. This action will adjust the stock's trading on the NYSE and impact equity incentive plans. Analysts currently rate STEM stock a "Hold" with a $1.00 price target, while TipRanks' AI Analyst, Spark, rates it as "Neutral" due to financial instability, though acknowledging potential for improvement.

feed.title: Stem Brass Beat Shareholder Lawsuit Over SPAC Merger Claims (1)
feed.summary: A federal judge dismissed a shareholder lawsuit against Stem Inc. and its blank-check merger sponsor, which alleged that investors were misled during the energy storage company's SPAC deal. Judge Maryellen Noreika of the US District Court for the District of Delaware overruled investor objections and sided with an earlier recommendation to dismiss the claims against current and former executives and directors.

feed.title: Stem, Inc. to Acquire Also Energy Holdings, Inc., a Global Leader in Solar Asset Management Software
feed.summary: Stem, Inc. is set to acquire Also Energy Holdings, Inc. in a stock and cash transaction valued at $695 million. This acquisition aims to combine Stem's energy storage optimization capabilities with AlsoEnergy's solar asset management software, creating a comprehensive solution for renewable energy projects. The transaction is expected to be immediately accretive to Stem's gross margin and EBITDA and expand its global reach and software offerings.

feed.title: Stem Completes Business Combination with Star Peak Energy Transition Corp.
feed.summary: Stem, Inc. announced the completion of its business combination with Star Peak Energy Transition Corp., creating the first publicly traded pure-play smart energy storage company. The transaction resulted in over $600 million of gross cash proceeds for Stem, whose common stock began trading on the NYSE under the symbol "STEM" on April 29, 2021. This move is set to accelerate Stem’s growth and expand its leadership in AI-driven clean energy storage systems, with significant capital dedicated to product advancement, capability expansion, and market reach.
